quote: Learning sleeps and snores in libraries, but wisdom is everywhere, wide awake, on tiptoe.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Perspective is worth 80 IQ points.
author: Alan Kay

quote: Public opinion is no more than this: what people think that other people think.
author: Alfred Austin

quote: Wisdom is a sacred communion.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Tis but a part we see, and not a whole.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: You can't sweep other people off their feet, if you can't be swept off your own.
author: Clarence Day

quote: It is the neglect of timely repair that makes rebuilding necessary.
author: Richard Whately

quote: Wisdom is knowing what to do next; virtue is doing it.
author: David Starr Jordan

quote: Wisdom begins at the end.
author: Daniel Webster

quote: Counsel woven into the fabric of real life is wisdom.
author: Walter Benjamin

quote: It is much more difficult to measure nonperformance than performance.
author: Harold S. Geneen

quote: Self-suggestion makes you master of yourself.
author: W. Clement Stone

quote: Life is a travelling to the edge of knowledge, then a leap taken.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

quote: If you believe the doctors, nothing is wholesome; if you believe the theologians, nothing is innocent; if you believe the military, nothing is safe.
author: Lord Salisbury

quote: Spectacular achievement is always preceded by unspectacular preparation.
author: Robert H. Schuller

quote: Virtues are acquired through endeavor, which rests wholly upon yourself.
author: Sidney Lanier

quote: The wisdom of the wise is an uncommon degree of common sense.
author: Dean Inge

quote: Wise kings generally have wise counselors; and he must be a wise man himself who is capable of distinguishing one.
author: Diogenes

quote: It is astonishing with how little wisdom mankind can be governed, when that little wisdom is its own.
author: William Ralph Inge

quote: Rarely promise, but, if lawful, constantly perform.
author: William Penn

quote: The future has already arrived. It's just not evenly distributed yet.
author: William Gibson

quote: Few of the many wise apothegms which have been uttered have prevented a single foolish action.
author: Thomas B. Macaulay

quote: The difference between chirping out of turn and a faux pas depends on what kind of a bar you're in.
author: Wilson Mizner

quote: Man's wisdom is his best friend; folly his worst enemy.
author: William Temple

quote: Wisdom ceases to be wisdom when it becomes too proud to weep, too grave to laugh, and too selfish to seek other than itself.
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: Keep me away from the wisdom which does not cry, the philosophy which does not laugh and the greatness which does not bow before children.
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
author: Jimi Hendrix

quote: Because in the school of the Spirit man learns wisdom through humility, knowledge by forgetting, how to speak by silence, how to live by dying.
author: Johannes Tauler

quote: Democracy is a pathetic belief in the collective wisdom of individual ignorance.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Tragedy is a tool for the living to gain wisdom, not a guide by which to live.
author: Robert Kennedy

quote: It is unwise to be too sure of one's own wisdom. It is healthy to be reminded that the strongest might weaken and the wisest might err.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: In order to have wisdom we must have ignorance.
author: Theodore Dreiser

quote: Knowledge without justice ought to be called cunning rather than wisdom.
author: Plato

quote: We give advice, but we cannot give the wisdom to profit by it.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: There is more wisdom in your body than in your deepest philosophy.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Follow your instincts. That's where true wisdom manifests itself.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Fear is the main source of superstition, and one of the main sources of cruelty. To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Where there is charity and wisdom, there is neither fear nor ignorance.
author: Francis of Assisi

quote: The invariable mark of wisdom is to see the miraculous in the common.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Earthly wisdom is doing what comes naturally. Godly wisdom is doing what the Holy Spirit compels us to do.
author: Charles Stanley

quote: Wisdom has its root in goodness, not goodness its root in wisdom.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Wisdom comes alone through suffering.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Cunning... is but the low mimic of wisdom.
author: Plato

quote: We don't receive wisdom; we must discover it for ourselves after a journey that no one can take for us or spare us.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Knowledge which is divorced from justice, may be called cunning rather than wisdom.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: A short saying often contains much wisdom.
author: Sophocles

quote: To keep your secret is wisdom; but to expect others to keep it is folly.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The key to wisdom is this - constant and frequent questioning, for by doubting we are led to question and by questioning we arrive at the truth.
author: Peter Abelard

quote: Enraging liberals is simply one of the more enjoyable side effects of my wisdom.
author: Rush Limbaugh

quote: Wisdom comes by disillusionment.
author: George Santayana

quote: Back of every mistaken venture and defeat is the laughter of wisdom, if you listen.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: The virtue of justice consists in moderation, as regulated by wisdom.
author: Aristotle

quote: Love is the wisdom of the fool and the folly of the wise.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Kindness is more important than wisdom, and the recognition of this is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Theodore Isaac Rubin

quote: Pain makes man think. Thought makes man wise. Wisdom makes life endurable.
author: John Patrick

quote: In complete darkness we are all the same, it is only our knowledge and wisdom that separates us, don't let your eyes deceive you.
author: Janet Jackson

quote: Lord, bless me with the ability to achieve all that I can, and the wisdom to realize it doesn't all have to be by tomorrow!
author: William Eardley IV

quote: If suffering brings wisdom, I would wish to be less wise.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: It is not wisdom but Authority that makes a law.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: Knowledge is proud that it knows so much; wisdom is humble that it knows no more.
author: William Cowper

quote: We have no words for speaking of wisdom to the stupid. He who understands the wise is wise already.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quote: Rightly defined philosophy is simply the love of wisdom.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: What wisdom can you find that is greater than kindness?
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: Not engaging in ignorance is wisdom.
author: Bodhidharma

quote: Gray hairs are signs of wisdom if you hold your tongue, speak and they are but hairs, as in the young.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: I do not believe in the collective wisdom of individual ignorance.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: If I am fool, it is, at least, a doubting one; and I envy no one the certainty of his self-approved wisdom.
author: George Byron

quote: Much wisdom often goes with fewest words.
author: Sophocles

quote: People always blame the girl; she should have said no. A monosyllable, but conventional wisdom has always been that boys can't manage it.
author: Anna Quindlen

quote: If you were to offer a thirsty man all wisdom, you would not please him more than if you gave him a drink.
author: Sophocles

quote: I prefer the folly of enthusiasm to the indifference of wisdom.
author: Anatole France

quote: The seat of knowledge is in the head; of wisdom, in the heart. We are sure to judge wrong, if we do not feel right.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: To think ill of mankind and not wish ill to them, is perhaps the highest wisdom and virtue.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Both in thought and in feeling, even though time be real, to realise the unimportance of time is the gate of wisdom.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: The stupidity of people comes from having an answer for everything. The wisdom of the novel comes from having a question for everything.
author: Milan Kundera

quote: In the vain laughter of folly wisdom hears half its applause.
author: George Eliot

quote: More helpful than all wisdom is one draught of simple human pity that will not forsake us.
author: George Eliot

quote: The final wisdom of life requires not the annulment of incongruity but the achievement of serenity within and above it.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: Wisdom is that apprehension of heavenly things to which the spirit rises through love.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: The hunger for facile wisdom is the root of all false philosophy.
author: George Santayana

quote: To acquire knowledge, one must study; but to acquire wisdom, one must observe.
author: Marilyn vos Savant

quote: A man may learn wisdom even from a foe.
author: Aristophanes

quote: It is the province of knowledge to speak, and it is the privilege of wisdom to listen.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: We can be knowledgable with other men's knowledge but we cannot be wise with other men's wisdom.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: The most certain sign of wisdom is cheerfulness.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Discipline is wisdom and vice versa.
author: M. Scott Peck

quote: It is good even for old men to learn wisdom.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Though sages may pour out their wisdom's treasure, there is no sterner moralist than pleasure.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Moderation is the inseparable companion of wisdom, but with it genius has not even a nodding acquaintance.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: That which seems the height of absurdity in one generation often becomes the height of wisdom in another.
author: Adlai E. Stevenson

quote: The pine stays green in winter... wisdom in hardship.
author: Norman Douglas

quote: Animals, in their generation, are wiser than the sons of men; but their wisdom is confined to a few particulars, and lies in a very narrow compass.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Whenever you argue with another wiser than yourself in order that others may admire your wisdom, they will discover your ignorance.
author: Saadi

quote: Vanity can easily overtake wisdom. It usually overtakes common sense.
author: Julian Casablancas

quote: Doubt is the vestibule through which all must pass before they can enter into the temple of wisdom.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Our own physical body possesses a wisdom which we who inhabit the body lack. We give it orders which make no sense.
author: Henry Miller

quote: In my definition of consciousness, consciousness is the same thing as life. What wisdom traditions also call spirit.
author: Deepak Chopra

quote: My mother is a great source of advice and wisdom and consolation for me.
author: Katherine Heigl

quote: The hours of folly are measured by the clock; but of wisdom, no clock can measure.
author: William Blake

quote: To build a great company, which is a CEO's job, sometimes you have to stand up against conventional wisdom.
author: Carly Fiorina

quote: Novels are the Socratic dialogues of our time. Practical wisdom fled from school wisdom into this liberal form.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: The extreme limit of wisdom, that's what the public calls madness.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: Wisdom has never made a bigot, but learning has.
author: Josh Billings

quote: They would need to be already wise, in order to love wisdom.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: Kindness is wisdom.
author: Philip James Bailey

quote: Wisdom is humble that he knows no more.
author: William Cowper

quote: I'm not wise, but the beginning of wisdom is there; it's like relaxing into - and an acceptance of - things.
author: Tina Turner

quote: Some wisdom you must learn from one who's wise.
author: Euripides

quote: It is almost everywhere the case that soon after it is begotten the greater part of human wisdom is laid to rest in repositories.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quote: Spending two years on my uncle's ranch in Montana as a young man gave me the wisdom and the thrust to do westerns.
author: Robert Duvall

quote: I'll come to you with gifts of knowledge, wisdom and truth.
author: Barry White

quote: I don't think you can come into your wisdom until you have made mistakes on your own skin and felt them in reality of your own life.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: Wisdom is knowledge which has become a part of one's being.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: Full of wisdom are the ordinations of fate.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: Saudi Arabia is a puritanical state that claims a monopoly of wisdom and virtue.
author: James Buchan

quote: He who is taught to live upon little owes more to his father's wisdom than he who has a great deal left him does to his father's care.
author: William Penn

quote: In complete darkness, it is only knowledge and wisdom that separates us.
author: Janet Jackson

quote: The truest greatness lies in being kind, the truest wisdom in a happy mind.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: One part of wisdom is knowing what you don't need anymore and letting it go.
author: Jane Fonda

quote: No one ever found wisdom without also being a fool. Writers, alas, have to be fools in public, while the rest of the human race can cover its tracks.
author: Erica Jong

quote: Logic is the beginning of wisdom, not the end.
author: Leonard Nimoy

quote: Silence at the proper season is wisdom, and better than any speech.
author: Plutarch

quote: One of the greatest pieces of economic wisdom is to know what you do not know.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: The enemy of the conventional wisdom is not ideas but the march of events.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: The left has come to regard common sense - the traditional wisdom and folkways of the community - as an obstacle to progress and enlightenment.
author: Christopher Lasch

quote: The art of storytelling is reaching its end because the epic side of truth, wisdom, is dying out.
author: Walter Benjamin

quote: Men who know themselves are no longer fools. They stand on the threshold of the door of Wisdom.
author: Havelock Ellis

quote: Purity engenders Wisdom, Passion avarice, and Ignorance folly, infatuation and darkness.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: Knowledge shrinks as wisdom grows.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Irony is the gaiety of reflection and the joy of wisdom.
author: Anatole France

quote: When you're used to being prepared to reject conventional wisdom, it leaves you open to learn more.
author: Mayim Bialik

quote: He was gifted with the sly, sharp instinct for self-preservation that passes for wisdom among the rich.
author: Evelyn Waugh

quote: Economists often like startling theorems, results which seem to run counter to conventional wisdom.
author: Joseph Stiglitz

quote: In the frank expression of conflicting opinions lies the greatest promise of wisdom in governmental action.
author: Louis D. Brandeis

quote: All free governments are managed by the combined wisdom and folly of the people.
author: James A. Garfield

quote: Mixing one's wines may be a mistake, but old and new wisdom mix admirably.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: There is a trade off - as you grow older you gain wisdom but you lose spontaneity.
author: Kenny Rogers

quote: I always see where I didn't do things the right way. I only see the heavy lifting. That's a bit of my wisdom, if you want to call it that.
author: Vera Wang

quote: It is wisdom in prosperity, when all is as thou wouldn't have it, to fear and suspect the worst.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

quote: Now that I am sixty, I see why the idea of elder wisdom has passed from currency.
author: John Updike

quote: Wisdom is not attained by years, but by ability.
author: Plautus

quote: To profit from good advice requires more wisdom than to give it.
author: Wilson Mizner

quote: Wisdom is oftentimes nearer when we stoop than when we soar.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Every speaker has a mouth; An arrangement rather neat. Sometimes it's filled with wisdom. Sometimes it's filled with feet.
author: Robert Orben

quote: The greater the step forward in knowledge, the greater is the one taken backward in search of wisdom.
author: Stephen Gardiner

quote: The weak have remedies, the wise have joys; superior wisdom is superior bliss.
author: Edward Young

quote: The clouds may drop down titles and estates, and wealth may seek us, but wisdom must be sought.
author: Edward Young

quote: Unhappy is that Grandeur which makes us too great to be good; and that Wit which sets us at a distance from true Wisdom.
author: Mary Astell

quote: It's very hard to know what wisdom is.
author: James Hillman

quote: The thing that we possess, that machines don't, is the ability to exhibit wisdom.
author: Herbie Hancock

quote: Without wisdom, the future has no meaning, no valuable purpose.
author: Herbie Hancock

quote: You can practice to attain knowledge, but you can't practice to attain wisdom.
author: Herbie Hancock

quote: I am thinking of taking a fifth wife. Why not? Solomon had a thousand wives and he is a synonym for wisdom.
author: John Barrymore

quote: I'm someone who's done the opposite of whatever the received wisdom is, to keep your career going into your 50s.
author: Elizabeth McGovern

quote: Sometimes one likes foolish people for their folly, better than wise people for their wisdom.
author: Elizabeth Gaskell

quote: Lessons of wisdom have the most power over us when they capture the heart through the groundwork of a story, which engages the passions.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: Sciences may be learned by rote, but wisdom not.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: Wisdom oft times consists of knowing what to do next.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: Wisdom consists not so much in knowing what to do in the ultimate as knowing what to do next.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: The greatest wisdom is to realize one's lack of it.
author: Constantin Stanislavski

quote: Has fortune dealt you some bad cards. Then let wisdom make you a good gamester.
author: Francis Quarles

quote: It is astonishing what force, purity, and wisdom it requires for a human being to keep clear of falsehoods.
author: Margaret Fuller

quote: I've always shied away from conventional wisdom, though I know the power of it.
author: Peter Jennings

quote: To light one candle to God and another to the Devil is the principle of wisdom.
author: Jose Bergamin

quote: My mom calls me an older soul because, growing up, she taught me stuff real early. Now I spend most of my time chasing wisdom, chasing understanding.
author: Ray Lewis

quote: They whom truth and wisdom lead, can gather honey from a weed.
author: William Cowper

quote: Wisdom consists of the anticipation of consequences.
author: Norman Cousins

quote: The wisdom acquired with the passage of time is a useless gift unless you share it.
author: Esther Williams

quote: A wholesome oblivion of one's neighbours is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Richard Le Gallienne

quote: Great wisdom is generous; petty wisdom is contentious.
author: Zhuangzi

quote: Even when you have doubts, take that step. Take chances. Mistakes are never a failure - they can be turned into wisdom.
author: Cat Cora

quote: We live in a culture that doesn't acknowledge or validate human intuition and doesn't encourage us to rely on our intuitive wisdom.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: The first point of wisdom is to discern that which is false; the second, to know that which is true.
author: Lactantius

quote: Great wisdom is generous; petty wisdom is contentious. Great speech is impassioned, small speech cantankerous.
author: Zhuang Zi

quote: Never accept ultimatums, conventional wisdom, or absolutes.
author: Christopher Reeve

quote: We all admire the wisdom of people who come to us for advice.
author: Arthur Helps

quote: A great memory is never made synonymous with wisdom, any more than a dictionary would be called a treatise.
author: John Henry Newman

quote: True wisdom listens more, talks less and can get along with all types of people.
author: Kiana Tom

quote: This fear of the Lord is indeed the beginning of wisdom. This consciousness of sin is the straight pathway to heaven.
author: Joseph Barber Lightfoot

quote: Conventional wisdom holds that setting a timetable for getting American troops out of Iraq would be a mistake.
author: Nick Clooney

quote: If an idea is indeed sensible, it will eventually become just part of the accepted wisdom.
author: Nigel Farage

quote: To suppose more than one supreme Source of infinite wisdom, power, and all perfections, is to assert that there is no supreme Being in existence.
author: Adam Clarke

quote: Genius unrefined resembles a flash of lightning, but wisdom is like the sun.
author: Franz Grillparzer

quote: Pain is the doorway to wisdom and to truth.
author: Keith Miller

quote: Wisdom not only gets, but once got, retains.
author: Francis Quarles

quote: This is perhaps the most profound meaning of the book of Job, the best example of wisdom.
author: Paul Ricoeur

quote: Wisdom finds its literary expression in wisdom literature.
author: Paul Ricoeur

quote: Whether the aim is in heaven or on earth, wisdom or wealth, the essential condition of its pursuit and attainment is always security and order.
author: Johan Huizinga

quote: I covered my face because they had taken my wisdom teeth out.
author: Josh Brolin

quote: No man is the wiser for his learning; it may administer matter to work in, or objects to work upon; but wit and wisdom are born with a man.
author: John Selden

quote: Wisdom too often never comes, and so one ought not to reject it merely because it comes late.
author: Felix Frankfurter

quote: Age does not bring you wisdom, age brings you wrinkles.
author: Estelle Getty

quote: Authority without wisdom is like a heavy ax without an edge, fitter to bruise than polish.
author: Anne Bradstreet

quote: We all have within us a deep wisdom, but sometimes we don't know we have it.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: When I wrote Living in the Light, I wanted to share about how I live my own life and to encourage people to tap into their own inner wisdom.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: What I lack in energy, I have in wisdom.
author: Marcia Cross

quote: I'm not a money manager, but I can tell you what the conventional wisdom is. The younger you are, the more risk you can take on.
author: Maria Bartiromo

quote: A monarchy conducted with infinite wisdom and infinite benevolence is the most perfect of all possible governments.
author: Ezra Stiles

quote: The constitutions of Maryland and New York are founded in higher wisdom.
author: Ezra Stiles

quote: Where fear is present, wisdom cannot be.
author: Lactantius

quote: It is costly wisdom that is bought by experience.
author: Roger Ascham

quote: Mainstream media tend to just mouth the conventional wisdom, to see everything through the filter of right and left.
author: Arianna Huffington

quote: Wisdom and goodness are twin-born, one heart must hold both sisters, never seen apart.
author: William Dean Howells

quote: The most important lesson of New Labour is this: Every time we made progress we did it by challenging the conventional wisdom.
author: Ed Miliband

quote: Contemplation and wisdom are highest achievements and man is not totally at home with them.
author: Gabriel Marcel

quote: Of all our possessions, wisdom alone is imortal.
author: Isocrates

quote: Humility is the only true wisdom by which we prepare our minds for all the possible changes of life.
author: George Arliss

quote: We do not sit as a superlegislature to weigh the wisdom of legislation.
author: William O. Douglas

quote: Theology in general seems to me a substitution of human ingenuity for divine wisdom.
author: Julia Ward Howe

quote: There is no knowledge, no light, no wisdom that you are in possession of, but what you have received it from some source.
author: Brigham Young

quote: Doubt the conventional wisdom unless you can verify it with reason and experiment.
author: Steve Albini

quote: He read his mind. He's a strange sort of man, isn't he? It's not just the advice and the wisdom that he has.
author: Omar Sharif

quote: You want people walking away from the conversation with some kernel of wisdom or some kind of impact.
author: Harry Dean Stanton

quote: All human wisdom works and has worries and grief as reward.
author: Johann Georg Hamann

quote: To keep your secret is wisdom; to expect others to keep it is folly.
author: William Samuel Johnson

quote: Nobility of spirit has more to do with simplicity than ostentation, wisdom rather than wealth, commitment rather than ambition.
author: Riccardo Muti

quote: It is not from reason that justice springs, but goodness is born of wisdom.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: For the subtlest folly proceeds from the subtlest wisdom.
author: John Webster

quote: To know one's self is wisdom, but not to know one's neighbors is genius.
author: Minna Antrim

quote: Our experience is composed rather of illusions that of wisdom acquired.
author: Joseph Roux

quote: The beginning of wisdom is to desire it.
author: Solomon Ibn Gabirol

quote: Books are the ever burning lamps of accumulated wisdom.
author: George William Curtis

quote: It is not white hair that engenders wisdom.
author: Menander

quote: Words of wisdom are spoken by children at least as often as scientists.
author: James Newman

quote: Wisdom is not acquired save as the result of investigation.
author: Sara Teasdale

quote: What is all wisdom save a collection of platitudes?
author: Norman Douglas

quote: The sublimity of wisdom is to do those things living, which are to be desired when dying.
author: Norman Douglas

quote: This age thinks better of a gilded fool Than of a threadbare saint in wisdom's school.
author: Thomas Dekker

quote: The 'wisdom of the crowds' is the most ridiculous statement I've heard in my life. Crowds are dumb.
author: Drew Curtis

quote: Books should to one of these fours ends conduce, for wisdom, piety, delight, or use.
author: John Denham

quote: Wisdom is knowing when you can't be wise.
author: Paul Engle

quote: After all my possessions had been burned, God gave me the wisdom to return to Jerusalem.
author: Shmuel Y. Agnon

quote: The key to wisdom is knowing all the right questions.
author: John A. Simone, Sr.

quote: Preconceived notions are the locks on the door to wisdom.
author: Merry Browne

quote: Pessimism is only the name that men of weak nerves give to wisdom.
author: Bernard De Voto

quote: We thought, because we had power, we had wisdom.
author: Stephen Vincent Benet

quote: Much of the wisdom of one age, is the folly of the next.
author: Charles Simmons

quote: Wisdom is keeping a sense of fallibility of all our views and opinions.
author: Gerald Brenan

quote: Remembering is painful, it's difficult, but it can be inspiring and it can give wisdom.
author: Paul Greengrass

quote: Even wisdom has to yield to self-interest.
author: Pindar

quote: Wisdom lies neither in fixity nor in change, but in the dialectic between the two.
author: Octavio Paz

quote: Most things break, including hearts. The lessons of life amount not to wisdom, but to scar tissue and callus.
author: Wallace Stegner

quote: We have heeded no wisdom offering guidance.
author: Dora Russell

quote: Knowledge is the consequence of time, and multitude of days are fittest to teach wisdom.
author: Jeremy Collier

quote: Rich people without wisdom and learning are but sheep with golden fleeces.
author: Solon

quote: Wisdom is a kind of knowledge. It is knowledge of the nature, career, and consequences of human values.
author: Sidney Hook

quote: Be there a will, and wisdom finds a way.
author: George Crabbe

quote: The study of history is the beginning of political wisdom.
author: Jean Bodin

quote: I am not one who was born in the custody of wisdom; I am one who is fond of olden times and intense in quest of the sacred knowing of the ancients.
author: Gustave Courbet

quote: Memory is not wisdom; idiots can by rote repeat volumes. Yet what is wisdom without memory?
author: Martin Farquhar Tupper

quote: We are to seek wisdom and understanding only in the length of days.
author: Robert Hall

quote: Wisdom prepares for the worst, but folly leaves the worst for the day when it comes.
author: Richard Cecil

quote: He whose wisdom cannot help him, gets no good from being wise.
author: Quintus Ennius

quote: Wisdom sails with wind and time.
author: John Florio

quote: Lord, give us the wisdom to utter words that are gentle and tender, for tomorrow we may have to eat them.
author: Mo Udall

quote: Books give not wisdom where none was before. But where some is, there reading makes it more.
author: Elizabeth Hardwick

quote: Every indication of wisdom, taken from the effect, is equally an indication of power to execute what wisdom planned.
author: Thomas Reid

quote: If the highest things are unknowable, then the highest capacity or virtue of man cannot be theoretical wisdom.
author: Leo Strauss

quote: To avoid entangling alliances has been a maxim of our policy ever since the days of Washington, and its wisdom no one will attempt to dispute.
author: James Buchanan

quote: Your aim will be knowledge and wisdom, not the reflected glamour of fame.
author: Abbott L. Lowell

quote: One reason the human race has such a low opinion of itself is that it gets so much of its wisdom from writers.
author: Wilfrid Sheed

quote: Knowledge is a process of piling up facts; wisdom lies in their simplification.
author: Martin Henry Fischer

quote: I think in conventional magazine wisdom, you need to have a redesign every decade or so.
author: Timothy White

quote: Mistakes are the usual bridge between inexperience and wisdom.
author: Phyllis Theroux

quote: Silence and reserve will give anyone a reputation for wisdom.
author: Myrtle Reed

quote: My past is my wisdom to use today... my future is my wisdom yet to experience. Be in the present because that is where life resides.
author: Gene Oliver

quote: The result showed the wisdom of your orders.
author: John Bigelow

quote: I actually think with age comes some level of wisdom.
author: Nina Totenberg

quote: Wisdom denotes the pursuing of the best ends by the best means.
author: Francis Hutcheson

quote: A proverb is the wisdom of many and the wit of one.
author: Lord John Russell

quote: Follow the wisdom of the great actor, James Cagney, you hit your mark, you look the other guy in the eye, and you tell the truth.
author: Larry Merchant
